trans-unit.source: Overview of Enterprise Integration | Microsoft Azure App Service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Overview of Enterprise Integration | Microsoft Azure App Service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use the features of Enterprise Integration to enable business process and integration scenarios using Logic apps
trans-unit.target: Use the features of Enterprise Integration to enable business process and integration scenarios using Logic apps

trans-unit.source: Overview of the Enterprise Integration Pack
trans-unit.target: Overview of the Enterprise Integration Pack

trans-unit.source: What is the Enterprise Integration Pack?
trans-unit.target: What is the Enterprise Integration Pack?

trans-unit.source: The Enterprise Integration Pack is Microsoft's cloud-based solution for seamlessly enabling business-to-business (B2B) communications.
trans-unit.target: The Enterprise Integration Pack is Microsoft's cloud-based solution for seamlessly enabling business-to-business (B2B) communications.

trans-unit.source: The pack uses industry standard protocols including [AS2](./app-service-logic-enterprise-integration-as2.md), [X12](./app-service-logic-enterprise-integration-x12.md), and [EDIFACT](./app-service-logic-enterprise-integration-edifact.md) to exchange messages between business partners.
trans-unit.target: The pack uses industry standard protocols including [AS2](./app-service-logic-enterprise-integration-as2.md), [X12](./app-service-logic-enterprise-integration-x12.md), and [EDIFACT](./app-service-logic-enterprise-integration-edifact.md) to exchange messages between business partners.

trans-unit.source: Messages can be optionally secured using both encryption and digital signatures.
trans-unit.target: Messages can be optionally secured using both encryption and digital signatures.

trans-unit.source: The pack allows organizations that use different protocols and formats to exchange messages electronically by transforming the different formats into a format that both organizations' systems can interpret and take action on.
trans-unit.target: The pack allows organizations that use different protocols and formats to exchange messages electronically by transforming the different formats into a format that both organizations' systems can interpret and take action on.

trans-unit.source: If you are familiar with BizTalk Server or Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services, you'll find it easy to use the Enterprise Integration features because most of the concepts are similar.
trans-unit.target: If you are familiar with BizTalk Server or Microsoft Azure BizTalk Services, you'll find it easy to use the Enterprise Integration features because most of the concepts are similar.

trans-unit.source: One major difference is that Enterprise Integration uses integration accounts to simplify the storage and management of artifacts used in B2B communications.
trans-unit.target: One major difference is that Enterprise Integration uses integration accounts to simplify the storage and management of artifacts used in B2B communications.

trans-unit.source: Architecturally, the Enterprise Integration Pack is based on **integration accounts** that store all the artifacts that can be used to design, deploy, and maintain your B2B apps.
trans-unit.target: Architecturally, the Enterprise Integration Pack is based on **integration accounts** that store all the artifacts that can be used to design, deploy, and maintain your B2B apps.

trans-unit.source: An integration account is basically a cloud-based container where you store artifacts such as schemas, partners, certificates, maps, and agreements.
trans-unit.target: An integration account is basically a cloud-based container where you store artifacts such as schemas, partners, certificates, maps, and agreements.

trans-unit.source: These artifacts can then be used in Logic apps to build B2B workflows.
trans-unit.target: These artifacts can then be used in Logic apps to build B2B workflows.

trans-unit.source: Before you can use the artifacts in a Logic app, you need to link your integration account to your Logic app.
trans-unit.target: Before you can use the artifacts in a Logic app, you need to link your integration account to your Logic app.

trans-unit.source: After linking them, your Logic app will have access to the integration account's artifacts.
trans-unit.target: After linking them, your Logic app will have access to the integration account's artifacts.

trans-unit.source: Why should you use enterprise integration?
trans-unit.target: Why should you use enterprise integration?

trans-unit.source: With enterprise integration, you are able to store all your artifacts in one place, which is your integration account.
trans-unit.target: With enterprise integration, you are able to store all your artifacts in one place, which is your integration account.

trans-unit.source: You can leverage the Logic apps engine and all its connectors to build B2B workflows and integrate with 3rd party SaaS applications, on-premises apps as well as custom applications
trans-unit.target: You can leverage the Logic apps engine and all its connectors to build B2B workflows and integrate with 3rd party SaaS applications, on-premises apps as well as custom applications

trans-unit.source: You can also leverage Azure functions
trans-unit.target: You can also leverage Azure functions

trans-unit.source: How to get started with enterprise integration?
trans-unit.target: How to get started with enterprise integration?

trans-unit.source: You can build and manage B2B apps using the Enterprise Integration Pack via the Logic apps designer on the **Azure portal**.
trans-unit.target: You can build and manage B2B apps using the Enterprise Integration Pack via the Logic apps designer on the **Azure portal**.

trans-unit.source: You can also use [PowerShell](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt652195.aspx "Logic apps PowerShell topics") to manage your Logic apps.
trans-unit.target: You can also use [PowerShell](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt652195.aspx "Logic apps PowerShell topics") to manage your Logic apps.

trans-unit.source: Here is an overview of the steps you need to take before you can create apps in the Azure portal: ![overview image
trans-unit.target: Here is an overview of the steps you need to take before you can create apps in the Azure portal: ![overview image

trans-unit.source: What are some common scenarios?
trans-unit.target: What are some common scenarios?

trans-unit.source: Enterprise Integration supports these industry standards:
trans-unit.target: Enterprise Integration supports these industry standards:

trans-unit.source: EDI - Electronic Data Interchange
trans-unit.target: EDI - Electronic Data Interchange

trans-unit.source: EAI - Enterprise Application Integration
trans-unit.target: EAI - Enterprise Application Integration

trans-unit.source: Here's what you need to get started
trans-unit.target: Here's what you need to get started

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription with an integration account
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription with an integration account

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 to create maps and schemas
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 to create maps and schemas

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Logic Apps Enterprise Integration Tools for Visual Studio 2015 2.0
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Logic Apps Enterprise Integration Tools for Visual Studio 2015 2.0

trans-unit.source: Try it
trans-unit.target: Try it

trans-unit.source: [Try it now](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/201-logic-app-as2-send-receive) to deploy a fully operational sample AS2 send & receive logic app that uses the B2B features of Logic Apps.
trans-unit.target: [Try it now](https://github.com/Azure/azure-quickstart-templates/tree/master/201-logic-app-as2-send-receive) to deploy a fully operational sample AS2 send & receive logic app that uses the B2B features of Logic Apps.
